v3kM0rHKpaTI12F37-QgNQ.text: A very nice addition to the Edinburgh breakfast scene. Very nice interior. Straight forward menu. I went for a hangover breakfast with a friend during the heat of the Fringe. Even though it was packed still felt quite comfortable inside. Opted for the full English which was served generously. They make their own baked beans which were quite dry but rest was enjoyable. Unfortunately the coffee wasn't as good as I would have expected from a new Edinburgh cafe but easy to correct. Definitely worth a visit, even if it is just for the cute waitress. All in all, a very good new addition to Old Town!

KkCzXwGZ_kM0J9hQByUoxA.text: The soup is great, their sandwiches are excellent, and the place fills you with a sense of innate wholesome goodness. It's really good place!  Overall, we said: "it's fair to say that I was rather pleased with my visit to the Edinburgh Larder. They've recently opened a bistro on Alva Street, and I've been promising to visit. This experience will certainly serve to accelerate my plans, as I can think of few places in town that serve such high quality fare, particularly at the very reasonable prices they charge. I'd recommend you pay the place a visit at your earliest convenience. There's a good chance you'll find me there, too, as now that I've finally found it, I suspect I'll be a frequent visitor."

iJ1WV696I-fFPbekeMfu-w.text: Enjoyed a late lunch here a few weeks back--I would DEFINITELY return, I loved the relaxed and unpretentious atmosphere of the place and the staff were extremely friendly and polite. Food portions are admittedly on the small size from what we saw, but that would be the only complaint for this place, and it wouldn't stop me from coming back or recommending it to others.

xJhb6fvINMazCfNNHUAIIQ.text: very small  and was very crowded  - we waited 10-15 minutes on a weekday - worth the wait tho - the vegetarian haggis was really good and the traditional Scottish breakfast was excellent - My wife had eggs and pastry and jam which were all quite good  - everything on the menu is homemade and locally sourced - server was a super young man with a great attitude -  a very cheery way to break fast in the busy city of edinburgh -  there is parking nearby  -  use it !   make sure not to park without a pass or in a zig zag line zone!!

P9P9m_o_f-67bPea3kpY-g.text: Big fan of this cafe - the scones are my favourite to find in Edinburgh! With jam and clotted cream, and warmed up too. I've yet to try anything else, but shall certainly be returning in the future.

kixMvKJUl-T0BIiocEMPvA.text: To be honest, this isn't really a shop you come in for a cheap spot of lunch and a quick snack in order to satisfy a grumbling stomach - it's a shop you come to if you are after that something that is a little bit special, something with a touch of uniqueness to it.    You see the goods sold here are something special - from lovingly made jams to brownies that will make your heart melt in anticipation made just perfect so you can enjoy them as much as possible.  However, as always when you find something that good and a cut above the rest there is a catch.  Unless you are buying a few items from here as a one off, say a gift or a treat, then unless you are loaded and able to spend your money as if it really did grow on trees then you won't be able to come here very often, simply because you won't be able to afford it.  That said, this shop is very good at what it does.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

TToRg6iAtFpf3Q-tYDHOKQ.text: Was just the most perfect arrival food after a three-leg Trans-Atlantic flight. Had a simple soup and sandwich and couldn't have been happier.   Also, there's an open wifi network nearby. Bonus.

dFqvGmz5iKoKEU6-abUAnQ.text: Had lunch here after checking into our hostel while staying in Edinburgh. The food was delicious. I had a haggis and steak pasty which was amazing. Great little place. Would go back if I were ever in town again.

pi4x2-RUkspDuAfPZ4I7mQ.text: Lovely hole-in-the-wall cafe with a family feel and great food.  Eat in and have cous cous and salad with your sandwich. Coffee was very well-made, and despite the busy atmosphere, the service was great.  Lots of goodies on sale: I walked out with a slab of blueberry white chocolate!

mLI3kTerjloF2zyDwoeqUg.text: Like Stephanie, I received one of these amazing goody bags!! I was amazed at the quality of products so I decided to pop along and check this place out! I wasn't disappointed, it's a lovely little cafe, really organic-feeling and has a lovely atmosphere. I sat and had a coffee here and watched the world go by. Unlike most chain stores, I didn't feel under any pressure and wasn't hassles every few minutes. It was lovely!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

2tRm4fUzn3weWV3Qm3z0YA.text: Big hot latte, a date and walnut scone warmed through in an oven (not a micro) and a dollop of clotted cream and homemade strawberry jam.  Add to that a very happy pregnant lady serving with smiles all round and you've got the perfect recipe for a mid morning 'fly cuppa'. Little bit crowded but great none-the-less. Will be coming back this way again!..........hope she was with child and I haven't made another classic Al faux pas.

MOPgk8P4CVmjM2RsyL7vLQ.text: Just delicious. We dropped in here after a hike to Arthur's seat, and it was so nice to get in somewhere warm and cosy! Love their half soup / half sandwich combo. I also tried their chicken and leek pasty - yum, with an amazing side salad.

QdRms5XXBjuzKqRoeyQR0Q.text: We stopped in for a sandwich after reading the menu. Not only did we love our choices (chicken/herb mayo and smoked chicken/chutney and brownie for dessert) but we loved the experience. The staff were super friendly and seemed to really enjoy working here. You don't often see that. We highly recommend this cafe!

Dr4NUTWf9s4v-OKy3G_jLQ.text: Such an adorable place with very accommodating and kind staff. Loved everything about the restaurant itself and the nice workers just made the experience even more pleasant. Started with a cheese plate which was delicious then had half sandwich/soup combo. The chicken and mushroom soup was amazing! Had a ham sandwich which the bread was great. We ended with a slice of the red velvet cake and the frosting was to die for. If I lived in Edinburgh this place would be on my weekly list!

CQ-5folvSeALj2NwRjnlxg.text: Fantastic. Smoked salmon sandwich was amazing and the smoked cheese with local chutney was just superb as well. I will be coming back and suggesting to the family.

m3Y5sGetXTqf5spisCN2hQ.text: Tucked away in the west end this is a beautiful wee place for afternoon tea (cute and quirky) dinner (which is amazing! Steak is the best I have ever had) & my boss has been kind enough to get me a birthday cake from there which was 'healthy' again it was delicious!

GsP67FTZ0iAr9XRp1vaGKQ.text: Simply put, this place is great.   Local ingredients of the highest quality.  Amazing local treats...  salmon/ smoked fish, cheeses, sausages/ charcuterie, chutneys.. A+ breads.. OAT CAKES.. (organic) local salads.. Quiche.. pies.. fresh as can be..  Beautiful tea's.. as well as cakes and sweets..  Cosy, cool setting without having to be "hip"..  and great people..  I could eat here everyday.  You should eat here at least once.  One of my favorite lunches in the world.. and perfect packing for a summer picnic.  It's a True gem.

AM9SZECzYze1oGI5MHpK7Q.text: Yummy french toast with fruit compote. Coffee is excellent. Really can't go wrong here. It's a food gem.

ayRJoVX8wOCeN53YRmn3Fw.text: We ran across this place, just off the Royal Mile.  Very cute.  Truly local sourcing.  Much better than the tourist traps on the main street.  Good vegetarian options.

xAhyPCyKAPlDkaOEexHLhw.text: We trekked across town to eat breakfast at The Edinburgh Larder solely based on the reviews we read on yelp.  This place was lovely!  The service was very friendly and prompt.  And the food was really delicious!  It all tasted fresh and was cooked to perfection.  My hands down favorite was the baked egg with toast.  It was superb!  We also had the full breakfast and a scone which were both wonderful.  It's a comfortable spot and we felt very welcome and has a great meal.  We highly recommend that you give it a try!

hccYpM5SbpEuxznxwjfuRA.text: Review is for the cafe side. Got two breakfast rolls with bacon and cheddar for takeaway before hiking Arthur's Seat. Rolls were fresh, soft and flavorful all on their own. The bacon was hot which helped to melt the thick slices of cheese. Generous portions provided a good ratio of roll to filling, and the sandwiches hit the spot. Excellent coffee and reasonable prices made for a great on-the-go breakfast. Lots of options for salads, sides, and other breakfast combinations as well. The scones looked incredible, but we saw them as we were leaving and didn't get a chance to try.

7ZetB5R58RMifUkGvZXmXA.text: Simply the best breakfast in Edinburgh. Farm-to-table ingredients and everyone on staff is very present to the idea that they want the customers to feel comfortable and well-fed, but in a very genuine, kind way.  Coffee and wifi are spot on and my go-to is the salmon and eggs with INCREDIBLE toast.   I travel to Edinburgh monthly and The Larder is a stop I always make.

2kfFS7Amy0jq-jmuY__pfQ.text: Went here two days in a row because we loved it so much. The scones are to die for. Tea was good, also got the Scottish breakfast and the porridge. Everything was fantastic!

NthIepN0MMBr39p-hwV-gg.text: This place serves a mean Scottish platter that will change your life. All my roads led me to the best brunch in town. Order it or die trying.

p7aif8t7X3GEYpWxHltSXg.text: Food was good, but price category should be two Great British Pound signs as breakdast was more expensive than other one GBP category restaurants that I have been to. Also, they do not honor 10% off with Yelp, and they were cash only.

QciGiMTW-9_FAWaz3vemZg.text: Traditional Scottish breakfast and very cozy atmosphere. We tried the most classic one -- whole breakfast which has black pudding. Foods are great and delicious, black pudding tastes a little bit strange to me, but still worth to have a try! Don't miss this restaurant for breakfast when u stay in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5-llrlVk7DlRxViF5cnghQ.text: Food:  Full breakfast: exactly what you might have expected, decent but nothing crazily amazing. Scrambled eggs w toast: simple but so good. The egg was perfectly cooked and fluffy/creamy, the toast was also perfect.   Service: That's where I deduct 1 star. I have been here twice. The first time the lady was very friendly but she forgot to take my order while there were only 2 customers in the restaurant at that time. The second time this place was almost full, and the server was less welcoming. I stood for like 3-5 minuets before being seated, and it took them 25 minutes to have my scrambled eggs ready.

iEWCFT_DYqXkNG09fy8Ihg.text: Had a lovely time here! It was cute and compelling, and the food was delicious as well. I was, however, a tad disappointed with the decor and practicality of eating in the joint. The room felt unfinished, as if the decor was almost all there but the thought wasn't fully carried through. And the large farm style table at the side of the joint, albeit cute, was a logistical nightmare! Moving parties of two in and out of the center seats of the table was near impossible with the overload of coats and hats and gloves that were necessary on the brisk day. If the decor was updated a tad the place would be perfect! As is was though, I had a good brunch and don't by any means regret spending my money  but would not go back.

f_akv6yIe1-NASPqeIe0pg.text: Visited there in search of lunch--left with happy tummies--delicious sandwiches and soup-- took some homemade chutney and jam with us--a real gem!

eOu0-6vW3US3A1tARLVd9g.text: Excellent little cafe with a wide choice of organic and locally grown produce.  This was our first visit and we weren't disappointed.  Friendly, quick service but a bit of a wait until the food arrived - as it's all made fresh to your order (so no complaints there !).  Jilly had a chicken sandwich and I went for the Scottish smoked salmon - both were served on delicious local granery bread. Only 26-30 seats and a very small kitchen - you may have to wait for a table but it's well worth it. The staff are obviously passionate about food and local produce.  Highly recommended !

6jjCUcgmps2yJv0R40DNHg.text: We had the most wonderful coffees, scones and brownie yesterday and plan on returning today for breakfast. We loved Charlotte - so friendly and even helped us with a dinner reservation!  Take the time to find this small gem - it's worth it!

hTK5tD87egohZQp3lPzULg.text: Food is good, but the coffee is surprisingly bad, breakfast spoiled...   They didn't accept the Yelp 10% discount (it was validated on the app) and just walked away after saying no to me, an explanation would have been nice.

CeCRmoi8ZDKqnrvFb3c7kw.text: Delicious scrambled eggs and Salmon. However they do not accept the 10% off that Yelp promises if you 'check in' here via Yelp. They apparently have told Yelp before to stop offering the 10% off.... YELP - get your act together!

D2W_SxGvADvpAsoWYrmI3g.text: I am Chinese , from north of China.i am here for fringe festival. One day I was hungry and I saw a Chinese restaurant with northern Chinese food. I was curious how is teast so I went there . Was really really good ! So yammmmm ! !

OLbczFfg2fqGk13Igzwclw.text: They absolutely know what they're doing here. The whole place feels warm and wholesome, and the food seems pretty good for you too. In fact, I uploaded a pic to Yelp of one of the counters and intended to caption in "counter of yumness" but it autocorrected to "counter of thinness"... Realising the counter was laden with fruits and salads, I didn't bother changing it back...  I came here for lunch with the lovely Candace B because I'd heard they were pretty good with the whole gluten free thing. I asked what the GF options were on her behalf and was amazed to sit there for no small length of time while our delightful waiter excitably rattled off all the choices. When I came to order my sandwich a little later, he remembered I'd asked and explained with kind concern that the sourdough wasn't GF, whereon I explained that I'd been asking for my companion.  The sandwich - chicken with herby mayo - was lovely, although it needed a bit of salt and our salt cellar didn't want to play. That latter bit wasn't really their fault; more likely it was the fault of people who, like me, are too timid to say "excuse me, this salt cellar is empty"... The sandwich also came with a gorgeous beet root and spelt salad, which was really filling. I loved it.  The staff couldn't have been more cheery and helpful, a real joy, and a great clientele there too, judging by the young man sitting by the door with a Monkey Island game on the chair beside him. "My cat is called Guybrush, sir," I told him, and sailed out the door without another word, feeling awesome and well fed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken sandwich
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Counter of thinness

BcQ4nshTzxPE5qYlakV-Ag.text: Cute cafe & really good service. Right off the royal mile which is convenient. I had the scrambled eggs with toast. The eggs were a little salty for my taste, but my friend had the big traditional breakfast and loved it.

DwC1kqMqU-zu6gaR2V7nZA.text: I was looking forward to eating here after reading reviews and looking at the menu.  Unfortunately, the hype was just too much.   I ordered a pork loin sandwich and oh my, the amount of meat was pitiful.  It was like small, thin islands of pork swimming in a sea of bread (albeit, delicious bread).  I am sure  i did not order the weight loss sandwich but that's what I got.  Too bad.  The brownie was at least, much more filling and tasty to boot.  I was starving after so I found some cullen skink at another place and was happy.  Finally.

E1kTt4Pcm3T9S5TlLAnqqQ.text: I went to this place with my friends for lunch today. I really love the atmosphere there, especially in such a rainy day when everything looks grey. We all ordered soup with 1/2 sandwich which cost 7 pounds each. Mine was Ham + Scottish cheddar + homemade chutney - it's really nice! I never had chutney before but it turns out delicious with Ham and bread. My friend ordered a salmon one and the order ordered the sandwich with halloumi - they were all satisfied with their food!  Although I enjoyed eating there, I don't see there's a reason for people to wait in a long queue just to get in. I guess the best part of this place would be the dessert and scone there rather than lunch and dinner.

EKASAzXZR5LdqRc2VFhzPQ.text: We ordered a drip coffee/black coffee/filter coffee, whatever you call it where you're from, and got an Americano. That is not the same thing. We ordered porridge, one with honey, and one with honey and fruit coulis. We got one with coulis and one with honey and coulis. I don't understand how it's possible to get all these things wrong, it wasn't even a busy time. Will not be returning. Also, don't check in for the 10% off, they don't accept that, it's False advertising from Yelp.

CYz1bXELb4jKoxzNDgr40w.text: I had a fine breakfast of scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, and toast here. Really enjoyed it, and everything was done perfectly. They've got a pretty small staff so it seems like service is a bit slow, but that's no problem. Just budget your time accordingly as the food is worth it.

W0xE_EBla8fgfG4RiAJVmw.text: If you check our reviews, you'll see we almost never rate fives; their is usually something to improve on.  But we give Larder a 5 and have eaten their 3 times in our 4 night stay in Edinburgh, also something we usually don't do. Every one of the salads were interesting & wonderful as were the sandwiches, fritatas & soups.  And every one of the staff were friendly & helpful not only with food suggestions, but asking us about our visit & giving suggestioned sights to see. We would say "we'll be back", but we already have been!

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Coffee as tasty as it is pretty

1q1ucdjvni5oO09nKpIDBw.text: FOOD 5// AMBIANCE 4// SERVICE 5  I had the most amazing experience at this cafe! I stopped in about an hour before their closing time on a weekday -- I was a bit dismayed to see them clearing up so early but thought I could stop in and sit down for a scone & coffee for a few minutes. The Larder has two sides to it and upon entering the first one, I was told that they were closing up and not serving food anymore. I replied that I just wanted a scone and cofffe. The employee ran over to the other side of the Larder and came back with a takeout bag for my scone. So yay, I got my scone! Upon as walking out, I stopped by the other half thinking this was a cafe/restaurant situation. I went in and asked for a coffee as well as for some jam for my scone. The Barista was a complete sweetheart and buttered & jammed my scone for me ! The cappuccino she made was FANTASTIC - just the perfect amount of milk and espresso, super smooth as well. The Scone was delicious as well. It tasted homemade and was not too flour-y as some other scones are ...it had depth and was very filling. She even allowed me to sit and enjoy my afternoon scone while she closed up the place. The ambiance is that of a regular cafe, some stool seating facing the street and some table. It was clean and nice!  In all, I was so blown away by the friendly service and high quality of scone / coffee. I cannot wait to go back and try their other foods!

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scone and cappuccino

A9MreGZTmMbkSxAKAR67IQ.text: Really good fresh food. I enjoyed my time here and this is a good place to stop for breakfast if you're looking for cafe food with a farm to table feel.

vF45eDrztfxqeijxPWhsbg.text: Terrible service. No recognition of customers that skipped in after us and grabbed the last table while we were waiting. Ended up leaving.

P6EygTVG6vqkidsQ8FAVrw.text: French toast and brioche, coffee, all very good. Nice atmosphere. Friendly service. Not fancy but comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Brioche
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. French toast

7NxbxbVKBxmFJXviPH7dwA.text: The food at this restaurant is fine. However the service is not that great. He showed up at 8:00am when they said they open. We were told come back at 8:30am.  We came back at 8:30am to find the place three quarters full and people already served drinks and such. We were given a table then promptly ignored. Another couple came in was seated and drink order taken. They then decided to finally get our drink order. Based off the service we won't be coming back.

bhGCWQC78oowOFlhyVmG9Q.text: My friend and I came here for lunch one day, and it was pretty packed! I got a baked egg, which came with toast and homemade jam. The homemade jam was AMAZING. The baked egg was also really interesting; I've never had one before but the waiter suggested it I think. It was pretty soft, and the texture was pretty good. I think it's somewhat similar to a poached egg. The only downside was that it was way too salty. My friend also got a scone, and I regretted not getting one because it was probably the best scone I've ever had. They ran out when I tried to order one. The price is somewhat high for the amount of food you get, but the service is pretty good and it's a pretty cozy place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baked egg with toast! Yum.

0O8h9WPAJ7m1jkADfNwZsw.text: Nice breakfast spot. Although right off the Royal Mile, it's absolutely no tourist trap. I tried the veggie breakfast, which was pretty good (although I have to admit I was no big fan of vegetarian Haggis). Scones were also great. Service and prices are OK.

N58KGG9Khj8W5N1QMcvDrQ.text: It is a "Farm to Fork" style cafe, which uses local ingredients. Located in old town off the Royal Mile. Casual charming ambience, the owner even had lunch at our same table, which was cool!!  We tried some sandwiches and pastry. Everything was great. The shredded beetroot salad which was served with both the entrees was the best I've ever had.

xW5oc9vWX1DnTBtj7OBZmg.text: Date: 31/01/16  Venue: medium size with large and small tables.  Food: delicious local produce. We had the mussels, ham sandwich and sausage roll.  Value: reasonably priced considering all products are fresh, local and of a high standard.  Service: prompt and friendly.  Verdict: would recommend for lunch or breakfast. 4.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mussels
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Open sausage roll
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ham sandwich

KZxNtFnMgof28EC92AGnbA.text: Long wait, but well worth it. Exceptional service and food. We had the eggs and French toast with bacon. Hate to give it the 5 Stars because more people will inevitably go. Can't wait to come back.

NeVHqpLFSSmafm4-kXd0MA.text: Delicious food, friendly staff. A little bit pricey but it depends on what you want to eat

cETadnoHfsBS1hDOG12MTA.text: I researched this place before our trip and decided to stop in due to the great reviews.  The cafe is situated near The Royal Mile which is a huge tourist attraction but I love that we were probably the only tourists in the shop lol.   I had the smoked salmon sandwich and hubby had the chicken sandwich. The sandwich was delicious!  I love the fresh salad.  I'm a huge fan of arugula and I love how tasty the salad was.  Definitely recommend this spot especially if you are a tourist :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Smoked salmon sandwich
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior

73FWZ67vB4UiuDLU82cbYA.text: On a five day long trip to Scotland for New Years, my family and I were looking for a nice place to eat brunch in Edinburgh and as we were walking down the streets, we stumbled upon, The Edinburgh Larder. As soon as we walked in, my family and I were greeted by an incredibly rude staff. To our surprise, they told us, "we're at capacity you guys need to leave. We don't have any more food.." We looked around the restaurant and there were clearly open tables available, but for some reason they just didn't want to seat us. There was no closed sign on the door, they never offered an apology, and they even laughed at us as they closed the door in our faces. It's very disappointing to me, in a city with such kind people, to find a group of staff that is so rude to their customers! I will never step foot in that place again, and I hope this serves as a warning to anyone who's hungry and cold in Scotland because you won't be seated at the Edinburgh Larder.

FQftUkpKELdPnZL1gt1Fmw.text: Edinburgh Larder is a nice breakfast place, that is pretty pop as people are queuing to get in. We went there at half 9 in the morning for an early Sunday breakie and were not disappointed: I really enioyed my scrambled eggs with salmon and toast together with mocca and freshly squeezed orange juice.  The place is unique as they bake their own bread and do their own jams and marmelades for sale. I was tempted to buy a coriander and ale chutney, but my backpack was already heavy so maybe another time.  The staff was friendly and attentive, so I would definitely come to Larder again for a coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Jams and marmelades for sale
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Homemade bread
Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scrambled eggs with salmon and toast

3P23J-lyy9PORNwEEGfv7A.text: Great service, ingredients, and meal. I felt like, for a reasonable price, I was paying to the community (local business using local suppliers) for an experience as part of the community (a local style meal). Also, best blood sausage I ever had. Exactly what we needed before hiking up to Arthur's Seat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Full Breakfast

h9unMXJJNEhZHzO-ilVzWA.text: Stopped in for lunch after landing in Edinburgh. All their menu items use locally sourced ingredients from all over Scotland.   I ordered the Ramsey's ham and mustard sandwich with 2 side salads. The salads were fresh and tasty, but very small. The sandwich was disappointing. Literally a slice of ham, lettuce and dijon mustard on wheat bread. Approximately 8.5 ($14.20), it was incredibly expensive.   Had I stopped eating at this point, the place would have warranted 3-stars. Tops.   However, I made the decision to order a tea and a scone with clotted cream and housemade strawberry jam. BEST DECISION EVER. The scone was slightly crumbly on the outside and soft on the inside. It went wonderfully with their clotted cream, AMAZING jam and a cup of tea.   Overall, a decent place to grab lunch if you live in the UK. Tourists with horrid exchange rates find food elsewhere. However, if you choose to dine at Edinburgh Larder, save room for their scone and tea. It's wonderful!

A7NwcBvSxvJc-Yd78zPAiQ.text: Fun, authentic and sooo not a chain. Good fresh food in an almost farmhouse ambience .

QLpsVoqvvXTzIkKa7uWxTg.text: Overrated by a lot. The food is good, say 4 stars, but the service is lacking and they only accept cash. The place would also need some cleaning especially in the ceiling. The bill wasn't for some reason correct, but we didn't complain since it was not worth our time. Walk past, you will surely find something better.

8HJdyM8848Q0abRjKK-BOw.text: Hidden away, just off The Royal Mile this cosy little gem serves up a "Full Breakfast" almost worthy of it's billing.  I say almost because I personally didn't care for the 'home-made' beans. A little lacking in salt and tomato flavour, but not colour for my liking, But OMG, the rest.  Sausage full of flavour and a Nuremberg texture, bacon sweet as, mushroom and black pudding sticky with soft yoke egg and tangy "Stokes" brown sauce, I loved it.  They say, "Break fast like a king",  here you will.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Perfect morning in Scotland (for an Englishman)

vY2L0wC1fK9whEt694Is-w.text: Small busy cafe. Lots to do in little space. Did not appreciate the bug zapper light hanging in the kitchen, firstly. Member of staff ate something with his hands and didn't then wash them.   Food was okay. Coffee bitter. Cake disappointing. Had a funny taste and no real "coffee"flavor as advertised. Service quick, friendly and quite good.  Wouldn't rush back, but basically okay.

wLpRjsC1lN0lyMKn54O3eA.text: This place is awesome. I had a mocha and scrambled eggs with salmon for 8.80 (due to the 10% discount offered by Yelp!). It was a really good breakfast that made me satisfied for a long time (which is important when you are a 21 years old backpacker).  I have to comment about the salmon since it was one of the freshest of my life. The coffee was really good too but I could get some grains at the bottom.  However, you must be patient to eat here because the place is incredibly popular and there was even a queue and I got there. So, I had to share a table with other people ( I don't mind but some people so).

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The queue to enter.

zBUMb_WMsPcsxonJc72vHg.text: Such a great place- really delicious and healthy soups and sandwiches. They are very reasonably priced and offer a wide range of breakfast items as well- I will be coming back!

sg65_dc7fkY_krq6ghv-Lw.text: Great breakfast spot; lovely people serving fresh food in a cute little spot. Tried black pudding for the first time and it was yum! Even the humble scrambled egg was delicious.

54QM61HvFhBxjEvMOohyeQ.text: We were served so horribly that we did not even come to the point of being served our meal.  The staff completely ignored us at first and treated us horribly when they finally talked to us. We wanted to go there for breakfast and did not have a lot of time due to our schedule for the day. We even told the waitress and asked how long it would take but she just lied to us. We ordered some tea and breakfast. It took them 15 minutes for one can of tea! Meanwhile three over tables arrived AND had already recoeved their dishes. We hadn't done anything to provoke the staff, we were behavig friendly and grateful. All we did was speak to each other (not to the waitress) in another language than English. From the first second, the waitress was being mean to us. There were several very cosy tables for two persons available but she told us to take one next to the door. It was very narrow, uncomfortable and cold. She was ignoring us and our order so well that we could not even pay our tea and leave. She obviously refused to serve us even though all we wanted was our bill. Finally we stood up and walked up to her, begging to finally be able to pay for the tea and cancelling the rest of our order (breakfast).  We did not have much change and she complained about us paying with a 50 note. She was not able to change the note at first so we had to wait for other customers to pay first.  Finally, we left. Disappointed ans still hungry. I do not know how this place has so many stars. Especially as we have had so many good experiences with restaurants in Edinburgh. This was the worst place I have ever been to. But I do need to admit that the interior was very beautiful. Still, I would not go there under any circumstances ever again.

EAJH39ncqLYYX4xSa2V0dg.text: Cute place, cute staff, cute food.  CUTE.  To the staff: seriously you guys, call me.

aI0RRK2GR7HBjoWVT5g9Bw.text: This could possibly be the best breakfast place in Edinburgh. Located in the city on the royal mile with great produce. They cook your breakfast and give it a special treatment. Full breakfast great sausage excellent black pudding. Even ketchup and brown sauce a cut above the rest. All done in a relaxed atmosphere not to formal.

53hRL7KHnwgsYWUiVNFZQQ.text: We came to the Larder for a full Scottish Breakfast, it was everything we needed and more. The home made beans were a great addition. I would highly recommend this place, the food is amazing and the guys who own it are super nice. 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Full Scottish minus the mushrooms, delicious

9RgTS7Yv0s5TUaHOFNSO9Q.text: Came here for lunch based on the great reviews I saw on Yelp. I guess I had very high expectations. The butternut squash soup was good but the smoked salmon sandwich was extremely dry. The bread seemed old and crumbly. The service was good but it was very busy for lunch time and I felt a bit rushed to finish eating as they were trying to seat other people waiting outside. We also waited on our food for more than 30minutes. Does it really take that long to pour soul in a cup and make two half sandwiches? Hmm...

9RD215kGxEtuirpAwFnWDA.text: We tried the Edinburgh Larder for dinner with an out of town guest.  The food was good and fresh, but the service and atmosphere was not anything too special.  If you are in the West End and looking for fresh scottish food, it is worth it, but we won't likely won't go out of the way to return.

y0MkVYltrC_nM-wEZ4iTGw.text: There is a lot of hype around this cafe and so I had really high expectations. I would say the lunch is probably better than the breakfast. There aren't a wide range of choices but from the choices there are - they're not bad. Good prices so it's worth a visit. I would advise going with the specials of the day as well because they've always been really interesting, fresh and yummy.

DO--R9BZu9_-HUigTcXETA.text: This place was delicious! Highly recommend it.  I had the 1/2 sandwich and soup combo in which I ordered the hot smoked salmon & beetroot relish sandwich and creamy spinach and leek soup. The sandwich was made with fluffy fresh bread and the saltiness of the salmon and sweet/sour relish balanced each other nicely. The soup was lovely as well. Chockful of veggies and not too creamy like regular American soups I'm used to.  The staff was super friendly too. Love the decor of the place: cute, clean, modern, socially and environmentally aware.  Just wish they gave bigger portion sizes for the value!

eHtj-rEPRANmzmLYRbD-5Q.text: Visited here on our last day in Edinburgh after stumbling across it by accident.  A very happy accident I might add.  We were greeted at the door by a very friendly waitress who told us to grab a table and get comfy.  The place was wedged but there was one table free by the door (luckily it was open as it was a scorcher of a day).  I love the mismatched tables and chairs it added a homely feel to the place in a way I can't describe.  One wall had shelves laden with their own produce (chutneys, jams and cordials) the other wall had a specials board and a map of Scotland showing where all of their ingredients were sourced from. As I am a coeliac I was delighted to see that they offered gluten free bread, lovely chunky slices of the stuff.  I ordered the scrambled eggs with bacon and toast and himself ordered the full breakfast.  I do see people complaining about slow service but the kitchen is teeny and you can see everything going on in it so it is to be expected that it's not going to be suprr fast.  Everything is cooked from scratch not kept on hot plates or anything like that.  The staff also made the wait enjoyable by getting all of the customers chatting almost like you were in a family kitchen at home. We did really enjoy the food here so much so that we didn't add anything once it hit the table, no salt, pepper or sauce.  This is a rare thing when you order scrambled eggs but they were so creamy and amazing they needed nothing else.  The eggs were put on top of the toast and I had to quickly rescue one slice before it got as soggy as the other one. Bottom line: the food is good but don't stop here if it's fast food you're after.

q68QBXs7SnSUCkBbe93Lhw.text: Friendly and familiar, pretty well managed! Delicious salmon and scramble eggs, to be tried!

N8ZYNCBadnRyeg6mWVkz6Q.text: The Edinburgh Larder is just off the Royal Mile but, tucked away on Blackfriars St, it tends to be filled with more locals than tourists. And it usually is filled. I went during a Sunday afternoon in the Festival to meet a friend for coffee. The place was packed but it had a nice ambiance to it and the coffee was great. I've heard they have great food so I'll be back another time to try it!

9b-OWewzowN_TCdK3oEQmw.text: Best carrot cake EVER! You must try it! :) I could move to Edinburgh just to eat here :)

hveXa7cfawt2p9Z8Ohtrxw.text: Delicious and gluten free! This cute stop off hit the spot for healthy, delicious fresh food!

cvZzCX78vOCxRCYhqzwumQ.text: Stopped in with my family for breakfast on our quick 2 day stay in Edinburgh before heading to the Highlands and days later we're all still raving about this gem. The breakfast was amazing--toast, eggs and bacon, all local--topped off with a serious good cup of coffee. The server was so sweet and friendly, he really made our visit that much better. I can't say enough about this small, cozy, perfect nook of a place in the heart of The Royal Mile. I will return!

RqEqzkOMTtPOm7UdOFSFEw.text: Many many moon agos we went here with a voucher for cake and tea for two. We ended up getting two orders of pork pie and a soup and half a sandwich on top of the tea and cake!  All the food was fantastic (hence two orders or pork pie), if the portions not overly large.  Great tea menu and a lot of their stuff is made on site and sourced locally.  I would happily return!!  Review with photos on my blog which can be found on my profile.   Happy Eating!

RtPTTIwGrGtSO9zXfrtJZQ.text: Very lovely breakfast joint near the centre of Edinburgh. Price is good and the food is very decent too. The coffee could have been better however.

KwTOKMSSinbHdipabznvVQ.text: Warning: don't come here for the sake of the food. If you're like me, the menu will scare you off or something. Come for the good purpose, good quality, and good service.  They focus on local ingredients that are fresh and healthy. You really can't pick something bad for you I think. The dishes all sound quirky, like I had a Ham and Cheese with Chutney, which was unique but surprisingly great! My friend had a Salmon and Beetroot sandwich, and that was good. We both got the seasonal spinach and leek soup, which I REALLY enjoyed.  The waitress was really awesome. She asked us about our day, our travels, and our interests. She was a real human being haha, not scripted or anything.  Don't expect to get full (which is why I put 4 stars) and it might be expensive, but you'll be satisfied knowing you supported a good cause and ate healthy. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Edinburgh Larder - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ham and cheddar and chutney

djELJWSjtKkTdjiQ0c4s0A.text: Been twice in two days on trip to this gorgeous city.  Fantastic servers and delicious, fresh, and well-sourced food.  Black sausage was to die for, as were scones.  Going back tomorrow.

gDPH-K6wK4xj_0vX2_G4wA.text: What a lucky find for us on Yelp!  Excellent locally sourced food and friendly and attentive service.

8menb1BpvX7y2CqW75Em7w.text: This wonderful little place is tucked away a half block off the Royal Mile in the heart of Edinburgh.  The food was simple and wonderful.  I had French toast with honey served with bacon.  It was a much better combination than I would have expected.  Karen had the best scrambled eggs that she'd had in two weeks of travel.    Decor and staff are interesting and pleasant.

7H_qRLlVb0A24FaYa2LsoA.text: Great atmosphere, delicious scones and espresso. I picked up a few new songs from the servers who were incredibly nice.

4lz-2_jbIx67SWQHzjtFjw.text: Visited Edinburgh, found out about this place, so we went and had the full breakfast. It was so good we decided to go back again the next day. Definitely recommended. Just off the royal mile. Coffee and scones were great, too

hXEAt7lCQSF5_NQ85p1j_g.text: Good food and friendly staff. I got the eggs benny and it was well done. Thanks! I really wish reviews didn't have to be longer, it's a simple recommendation.

QTkeU6ktEjSQhWQAyPYbYg.text: Pork Pie with salad and Spinach Benedict were both first-rate. "Salad" in the UK can be a dodgy mayo-fest, but the salad here was great slaw and roasted cauliflower/zucchini. Also a great beer list.

62jPIDWcu7_DNv9QN3j5Ew.text: I agree with the review saying there's good food but really poor service here. I'd say this place is 4+ stars, if the waiters weren't seemingly so miserable and careless. It's almost impossible to catch the attention of any server here - it's like they intentionally avert their eyes, only look down while waiting tables, and hope to avoid almost all interaction with dining guests.   Brunch for a solo diner took a bit over an hour, as another review mentioned, and most of it was spent waiting on the food to come, not on time spent enjoying the food. And closing the meal/getting the check is a whole other messy test in patience.  Everyone who sat at my communal table had various difficulties catching the attention of waitstaff, and appeared to be getting a tad angsty by the end of the meal.  My full Scottish breakfast was a pleasure and so was my chai latte, so it's unfortunate that service is so subpar and you don't feel welcomed dining here because people seem so unhappy and strained.

mfrmEV13o0UlDFzJY_i3dw.text: Wanted a place for breakfast & lunch but got here a little too late to try their breakfast items. The cafe is pretty small & they have a takeout place next door. We decided to sit down in the cafe. I tried a quiche with 2 side salads & my husband got the fish platter. Both were delicious.  My quiche came with some kind of Israeli couscous & a wild grain salad. They were fresh & tasty. The fish platter was very flavorful. We never tried fish pate or oatcakes but enjoyed it immensely.  The chutney was really really good. I wanted to buy a jar to bring home but no room in luggage!  Ended our lunch with a chocolate cake which was the perfect ending to our lunch. The staff was very nice.  Although I noticed people in general in Scotland are very nice!

Wjx5DKP--ZT2l3IHARbFNg.text: This is/was right across from my hostel. It is in old town which is tourist central, so granting that prices are high in this area this place was actually great for the amount spent! I got the "eggs benny", definitely no regrets there! The staff were kind, helpful, and I stayed there for over an hour drinking a decent chai tea latte while working on an essay. Would recommend for a bite to eat, but don't come hear if you are pinching pennies.

lw4VOYBM-Xe0NCDrg3vnkA.text: We ate here several times over the course of a week and enjoyed delicious, fresh, local food each time. Highly recommend the scones with clotted cream and jam, scrambled eggs with toast and sausage, and French toast with honey in particular. If you're in Old Town, stop by for breakfast one morning.

NwP-M1xEUcIti3vBSz4etg.text: Went here for breakfast and we loved it. Their bread is thick and delicious, the jam is homemade and the eggs are scrambled to perfection.  We couldn't help but try a brownie because they looked too good to pass up. The brownie was amazing. Gluten free and made with almond flour - had a very rich chocolate taste. Loved every bite of it.   I definitely recommend this place.

Ipp3iJtnaexpjmxwma5YMA.text: We happened to be staying right near this place and decided to drop in for Sunday breakfast and loved it. The decor is countryish and simple the service is friendly and accomodating and the choice of items on the menu good. I love that fact that a lot of their ingredients are locally sources from Scotland and they have a nice choice of breakfast and lunch items.  It was getting really busy shortly after we walked in and they turned away quite a few people and this was before 10am in the morning. That would suggest this place is extremely popular with locals and I can understand why.  I had the french toast for breakfast and it was excellent. I wish they served some maple syrup with it instead of the fruit compote but that wont stop me from ordering this dish again. The coffee was good and i also tasted the vegetarian Haggis which was excellent.  I would drop in here regularly if I lived in town :-))

I died for the depth and texture of that black pudding. All locally sourced-- you've never such orange egg yokes. Strong, bracing tea. Everything just as you'd hope it to be.

jYKYCqdtnMev2HZESxttAw.text: Another Yelp find. We were hungry and needed a place that served fresh food for lunch without feeling like a chain off the Royal mile. This place was perfect.  It's not a big menu, but it does things well include a great little fish plate with small salads, some crackers and copious amounts of fish served three ways. The cheese plate was actually fairly similar too and we enjoyed that as well.  The jams were also quite great and the chutney too.   The soups were the unexpected surprise. Quite fresh and creative. We got the cauliflower soup and it warmed up the late summer day.  Service was efficient and it was a cute little cafe.    A good find in the area.

6vtqsLVmWNNqMfMq9zQ-ew.text: Lovely cozy place great coffee and food with fresh Scottish ingredients. An awesome place for breakfast and brunch.

bETuzRz3OF8_BuapIeLXuw.text: My family and I walked in to this place to get some breakfast. We were rudely turned away with the excuse that "we are at capacity" even though there was a large open table. When they saw the confused look on my face after their first awkward excuse, they followed up by quickly saying that they were "out of food". There was no apology given and we were quickly rushed out the door. As soon as the door closed, we heard the laughter of the waitress that had rushed us out the door as well as the other patrons. If they were closed, I could understand, but there was no sign on the door. Also, it is strange that they were at capacity with no food to serve??? They could have at least offered us some coffee, or a chance to wait while the other patrons finished their meals.  Horrible experience, horrible service. I wouldn't eat here if I was starving in the streets, because I would be turned away.

Rks4pRfwX59pGjXtTTHQGw.text: First stop in Edinburgh for breakfast, and they didn't disappoint. Quaint restaurant with approximately seven tables; however, larger tables can be shared. Service was prompt and friendly.   Fabulous full Scottish breakfast, brioche bun with smoked salmon, freshly baked Raisin scone with tea and coffee. Leaving with a full belly.   *Didn't accept the 10% discount for checking in. We were coming regardless of the discount, so it didn't make a difference for us.

Js3GqlTwz34cnlNSD1YJDg.text: A pretty nice and affordable place to eat close to downtown Edinburgh. Had some delightful Scottish pub fare and a nice beer. Very friendly staff and pretty quick service too.

We absolutely recommend this place
